data.comment: The big names in today's match at Johan Cruijff Arena have now been confirmed.
Siemen Mulder starts the match. Sittard with the kick-off in Amsterdam.
In the minute 7, Goal! George Cox gives Sittard a 0-1 lead in Amsterdam.
Zian Flemming with an assist there.
Ajax have been awarded a penalty...
In the minute 32, Ajax are awarded a penalty ... Davy Klaassen botches the spot kick!
Goal! The home team draw level at 1-1 through Davy Klaassen.
In the minute 45, The ref's whistle signals the end of the first-half.
Ajax's Davy Klaassen scores with his head to give his side a 2-1 lead.
Siemen Mulder blows to start the second-half. Ajax with the kick-off.
Quincy Promes is replacing Jurgen Ekkelenkamp for Ajax at Johan Cruijff Arena.
In the minute 58, The away team have replaced Ben Rienstra with Samuel Moutoussamy. This is the first substitution made today by Kevin Hofland.
Erik ten Hag (Ajax) is making a second change, with Sean Klaiber replacing the possibly injured Noussair Mazraoui.
Lassina Franck Traore (Ajax) does not seem to be able to continue. He is replaced by Brian Brobbey.
In the minute 66, Erik ten Hag is making the team's fourth substitution at Johan Cruijff Arena with Dusan Tadic replacing Antony Santos.
The away team has substituted Mats Seuntjens with Emil Hansson. Kevin Hofland is thus making his second change.
Ajax take a comfortable 3-1 lead thanks to Brian Brobbey.
In the minute 79, Edson Alvarez is replacing Ryan Gravenberch for the home team.
Kevin Hofland (Sittard) is making a third substitution, with Lisandro Semedo replacing Sebastian Polter.
In the minute 85, Ajax have been given a penalty at Johan Cruijff Arena...
Martin Angha (Sittard) gets a yellow card.
Goal! Dusan Tadic extends Ajax's lead from the spot. They now lead 4-1.
Penalty! Siemen Mulder points to the spot, great chance for Ajax...
The whistle has gone to end the second half. The match finishes 5-2.
Quincy Promes smashes in a penalty at Johan Cruijff Arena. The score is now 5-1.
Goal! The away team reduce the deficit to 5-2 through a strike by George Cox. .
